intro: Tambourissa nitida, commonly known as the slender tambourissa, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its slender, vine-like stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fibrous roots and woody stems make it adaptable to various soil types. Tambourissa nitida is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
